@sl-slua/global/dangerouslyexecuterequir.documentation: Dangerously executes a required module function

@sl-slua/global/touuid.documentation: Converts a string, buffer, or uuid to a uuid, returns nil if invalid

@sl-slua/global/tovector.documentation: Converts a string to a vector, returns nil if invalid

@sl-slua/global/toquaternion.documentation: Converts a string to a quaternion, returns nil if invalid

@sl-slua/global/torotation.documentation: Converts a string to a rotation (quaternion), returns nil if invalid

@sl-slua/global/bit32.arshift.documentation: Shifts n by i bits to the right. If i is negative, a left shift is performed.\\nDoes an arithmetic shift: The most significant bit of n is propagated during the shift.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.band.documentation: Performs a bitwise AND operation on input numbers.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.bnot.documentation: Returns the bitwise negation of the input number.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.bor.documentation: Performs a bitwise OR operation on input numbers.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.bxor.documentation: Performs a bitwise XOR operation on input numbers.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.btest.documentation: Performs a bitwise AND operation on input numbers.\\nReturns true if result is non-zero.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.extract.documentation: Extracts bits from n at position field with width

@sl-slua/global/bit32.lrotate.documentation: Rotates n by i bits to the left. If i is negative, a right rotate is performed.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.lshift.documentation: Shifts n by i bits to the left. If i is negative, a right shift is performed.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.replace.documentation: Replaces bits in n at position field with width using value v

@sl-slua/global/bit32.rrotate.documentation: Rotates n by i bits to the right. If i is negative, a left rotate is performed.

@sl-slua/global/bit32.rshift.documentation: Shifts n by i bits to the right. If i is negative, a left shift is performed.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.documentation: Buffer manipulation library for binary data.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.create.documentation: Creates a buffer of the requested size with all bytes initialized to 0.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.fromstring.documentation: Creates a buffer initialized to the contents of the string.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.tostring.documentation: Returns the buffer data as a string.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readi8.documentation: Reads a signed 8-bit integer from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readu8.documentation: Reads an unsigned 8-bit integer from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readi16.documentation: Reads a signed 16-bit integer from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readu16.documentation: Reads an unsigned 16-bit integer from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readi32.documentation: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readu32.documentation: Reads an unsigned 32-bit integer from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readf32.documentation: Reads a 32-bit floating-point number from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readf64.documentation: Reads a 64-bit floating-point number from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writei8.documentation: Writes a signed 8-bit integer to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writeu8.documentation: Writes an unsigned 8-bit integer to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writei16.documentation: Writes a signed 16-bit integer to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writeu16.documentation: Writes an unsigned 16-bit integer to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writei32.documentation: Writes a signed 32-bit integer to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writeu32.documentation: Writes an unsigned 32-bit integer to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writef32.documentation: Writes a 32-bit floating-point number to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writef64.documentation: Writes a 64-bit floating-point number to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readstring.documentation: Reads a string of the given length from the buffer at the specified offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writestring.documentation: Writes data from a string into the buffer at the specified offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.len.documentation: Returns the size of the buffer in bytes.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.copy.documentation: Copies bytes from the source buffer into the target buffer.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.fill.documentation: Fills the buffer with the specified value starting at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.readbits.documentation: Reads up to 32 bits from the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/buffer.writebits.documentation: Writes up to 32 bits to the buffer at the given offset.

@sl-slua/global/coroutine.create.documentation: Returns a new coroutine that, when resumed, will run function f.

@sl-slua/global/coroutine.resume.documentation: Resumes a coroutine, returning true and results if successful, or false and an error.

@sl-slua/global/coroutine.running.documentation: Returns the currently running coroutine, or nil if called from in the main coroutine.

@sl-slua/global/coroutine.status.documentation: Returns the status of the coroutine: "running", "suspended", "normal", or "dead".

@sl-slua/global/coroutine.wrap.documentation: Creates a coroutine and returns a function that resumes it.

@sl-slua/global/coroutine.yield.documentation: Yields the current coroutine, passing arguments to the resuming code.

@sl-slua/global/coroutine.isyieldable.documentation: Returns true if the currently running coroutine can yield.

@sl-slua/global/coroutine.close.documentation: Closes a coroutine, returning true if successful or false and an error.

@sl-slua/global/debug.info.documentation: Returns information about a stack frame or function based on specified format.

@sl-slua/global/debug.traceback.documentation: Returns a human-readable call stack starting from the specified level.

@sl-slua/global/llbase64.encode.documentation: Encodes a string or buffer to base64

@sl-slua/global/llbase64.decode.documentation: Decodes a base64 string to a string, or buffer if asBuffer is true. The output is truncated at the first decoding error.

@sl-slua/global/lljson.documentation: JSON encoding/decoding library for Second Life.

@sl-slua/global/lljson.null.documentation: A constant to pass for null to json encode

@sl-slua/global/lljson.empty_array_mt.documentation: Metatable for declaring table as an empty array for json encode

@sl-slua/global/lljson.array_mt.documentation: Metatable for declaring table as an array for json encode

@sl-slua/global/lljson.empty_array.documentation: A constant to pass for an empty array to json encode

@sl-slua/global/lljson.encode.documentation: Encodes a Lua value as JSON. Raises an error if value contains unsupported types.

@sl-slua/global/lljson.decode.documentation: Decodes a JSON string to a Lua value. Raises an error if JSON is invalid.

@sl-slua/global/lljson.slencode.documentation: Encodes a Lua value as JSON, preserving SL types. Use tight to encode more compactly. Raises an error if value contains unsupported types.

@sl-slua/global/lljson.sldecode.documentation: Decodes a JSON string to a Lua value, preserving SL types. Raises an error if JSON is invalid.

@sl-slua/global/math.huge.documentation: A value larger than any other numeric value (infinity)

@sl-slua/global/math.abs.documentation: Returns the absolute value of n.

@sl-slua/global/math.acos.documentation: Returns the arc cosine of n in radians.

@sl-slua/global/math.asin.documentation: Returns the arc sine of n in radians.

@sl-slua/global/math.atan.documentation: Returns the arc tangent of n in radians.

@sl-slua/global/math.atan2.documentation: Returns the arc tangent of y/x in radians, using the signs to determine the quadrant.

@sl-slua/global/math.ceil.documentation: Returns the smallest integer larger than or equal to n.

@sl-slua/global/math.clamp.documentation: Returns n clamped between min and max.

@sl-slua/global/math.cos.documentation: Returns the cosine of n (n is in radians).

@sl-slua/global/math.cosh.documentation: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of n.

@sl-slua/global/math.deg.documentation: Converts n from radians to degrees.

@sl-slua/global/math.exp.documentation: Returns the base-e exponent of n.

@sl-slua/global/math.floor.documentation: Returns the largest integer smaller than or equal to n.

@sl-slua/global/math.fmod.documentation: Returns the remainder of x modulo y, rounded towards zero.

@sl-slua/global/math.frexp.documentation: Returns m and e such that n = m * 2^e.

@sl-slua/global/math.lerp.documentation: Linearly interpolates between a and b using factor t.

@sl-slua/global/math.log.documentation: Returns the logarithm of n in the given base (default e).

@sl-slua/global/math.log10.documentation: Returns the base-10 logarithm of n.

@sl-slua/global/math.map.documentation: Maps n from input range to output range.

@sl-slua/global/math.max.documentation: Returns the maximum value from the given numbers.

@sl-slua/global/math.min.documentation: Returns the minimum value from the given numbers.

@sl-slua/global/math.modf.documentation: Returns the integer and fractional parts of n.

@sl-slua/global/math.noise.documentation: Returns Perlin noise value for the point (x, y, z).

@sl-slua/global/math.pow.documentation: Returns base to the power of exponent.

@sl-slua/global/math.rad.documentation: Converts n from degrees to radians.

@sl-slua/global/math.random.documentation: Returns a random number within the given range.

@sl-slua/global/math.randomseed.documentation: Sets the seed for the random number generator.

@sl-slua/global/math.round.documentation: Rounds n to the nearest integer.

@sl-slua/global/math.sign.documentation: Returns -1 if n is negative, 1 if positive, and 0 if zero.

@sl-slua/global/math.sin.documentation: Returns the sine of n (n is in radians).

@sl-slua/global/math.sinh.documentation: Returns the hyperbolic sine of n.

@sl-slua/global/math.sqrt.documentation: Returns the square root of n.

@sl-slua/global/math.tan.documentation: Returns the tangent of n (n is in radians).

@sl-slua/global/math.tanh.documentation: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of n.

@sl-slua/global/math.isnan.documentation: Returns true if n is NaN.

@sl-slua/global/math.isinf.documentation: Returns true if n is infinite.

@sl-slua/global/math.isfinite.documentation: Returns true if n is finite.

@sl-slua/global/os.clock.documentation: Returns a high-precision timestamp in seconds for measuring durations.

@sl-slua/global/os.date.documentation: Returns a table or string representation of the time based on the provided format.

@sl-slua/global/os.difftime.documentation: Returns the difference in seconds between two timestamps. Same as a - b.

@sl-slua/global/os.time.documentation: Returns the current Unix timestamp or the timestamp of the given date.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.documentation: Creates a new quaternion with the given component values. Alias of quaternion.create.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.create.documentation: Creates a new quaternion with the given component values.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.normalize.documentation: Computes the normalized version (unit quaternion) of the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.magnitude.documentation: Computes the magnitude of the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.dot.documentation: Computes the dot product of two quaternions.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.slerp.documentation: Spherical linear interpolation from a to b using factor t.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.conjugate.documentation: Computes the conjugate of the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.tofwd.documentation: Computes the forward vector from the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.toleft.documentation: Computes the left vector from the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/quaternion.toup.documentation: Computes the up vector from the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.create.documentation: Creates a new quaternion with the given component values.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.normalize.documentation: Computes the normalized version (unit quaternion) of the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.magnitude.documentation: Computes the magnitude of the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.dot.documentation: Computes the dot product of two quaternions.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.slerp.documentation: Spherical linear interpolation from a to b using factor t.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.conjugate.documentation: Computes the conjugate of the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.tofwd.documentation: Computes the forward vector from the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.toleft.documentation: Computes the left vector from the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/rotation.toup.documentation: Computes the up vector from the quaternion.

@sl-slua/global/string.byte.documentation: Returns the numeric code of every byte in the input string within the given range.

@sl-slua/global/string.char.documentation: Returns a string containing characters for the given byte values.

@sl-slua/global/string.find.documentation: Finds the first instance of the pattern in the string.

@sl-slua/global/string.format.documentation: Formats input values into a string using printf-style format specifiers.

@sl-slua/global/string.gmatch.documentation: Returns an iterator function for pattern matches

@sl-slua/global/string.gsub.documentation: Performs pattern-based substitution in a string.

@sl-slua/global/string.len.documentation: Returns the number of bytes in the string. Identical to #s

@sl-slua/global/string.lower.documentation: Returns a lowercase version of the input string.

@sl-slua/global/string.match.documentation: Finds and returns matches for a pattern in the input string.

@sl-slua/global/string.pack.documentation: Packs values into a binary string.

@sl-slua/global/string.packsize.documentation: Returns the size of a packed string for the given format.

@sl-slua/global/string.rep.documentation: Returns the input string repeated a given number of times.

@sl-slua/global/string.reverse.documentation: Returns the input string with bytes in reverse order.

@sl-slua/global/string.split.documentation: Splits a string by separator. Returns a list of substrings.

@sl-slua/global/string.sub.documentation: Returns a substring from the given range.

@sl-slua/global/string.unpack.documentation: Decodes a binary string using a pack format.

@sl-slua/global/string.upper.documentation: Returns an uppercase version of the input string.

@sl-slua/global/table.documentation: Table manipulation library. Tables are collections of key-value pairs.

@sl-slua/global/table.concat.documentation: Joins an array of strings into one string, with an optional separator.

@sl-slua/global/table.foreach.documentation: Iterates over all key-value pairs in the table (deprecated).

@sl-slua/global/table.foreachi.documentation: Iterates over all index-value pairs in the array (deprecated).

@sl-slua/global/table.getn.documentation: Returns the length of an array (deprecated; use # instead).

@sl-slua/global/table.maxn.documentation: Returns the highest numeric key in the table.

@sl-slua/global/table.insert.documentation: Inserts an element at the specified index, or at the end of the array.

@sl-slua/global/table.remove.documentation: Removes and returns the element at the specified index from the array, or from the end of the array.

@sl-slua/global/table.pack.documentation: Packs multiple arguments into a new array with length field n.

@sl-slua/global/table.unpack.documentation: Unpacks array elements into multiple return values.

@sl-slua/global/table.move.documentation: Inserts elements [i..j] from src array into dest array at [d].

@sl-slua/global/table.create.documentation: Creates a new table with pre-allocated array capacity, optionally filled.

@sl-slua/global/table.find.documentation: Finds the first occurrence of a value in the array and returns its index.

@sl-slua/global/table.clear.documentation: Clears all elements from a table while keeping its capacity.

@sl-slua/global/table.shrink.documentation: Reduces the memory usage of the table to the minimum necessary.

@sl-slua/global/table.freeze.documentation: Freezes a table, making it read-only.

@sl-slua/global/table.isfrozen.documentation: Returns true if a table is frozen.

@sl-slua/global/table.clone.documentation: Creates a shallow copy of the table.

@sl-slua/global/utf8.charpattern.documentation: Pattern that matches exactly one UTF-8 byte sequence

@sl-slua/global/utf8.char.documentation: Creates a string from Unicode codepoints.

@sl-slua/global/utf8.codes.documentation: Returns an iterator that produces the byte offset and Unicode codepoint for each character in the string.

@sl-slua/global/utf8.codepoint.documentation: Returns the Unicode codepoints in the specified range of the string.

@sl-slua/global/utf8.len.documentation: Returns the number of Unicode codepoints in the specified range of the string, or nil and error index.

@sl-slua/global/utf8.offset.documentation: Returns the byte offset of the nth Unicode codepoint in the string.

@sl-slua/global/uuid.documentation: Creates a new uuid from a string, buffer, or existing uuid. Returns nil if the string is not a valid UUID. Throws an error if the buffer is shorter than 16 bytes. Alias of uuid.create

@sl-slua/global/uuid.create.documentation: Creates a new uuid from a string, buffer, or existing uuid. Returns nil if the string is not a valid UUID. Throws an error if the buffer is shorter than 16 bytes.

@sl-slua/global/vector.documentation: Creates a new vector with the given component values. Alias of vector.create.

@sl-slua/global/vector.zero.documentation: Constant vector with all components set to 0.

@sl-slua/global/vector.one.documentation: Constant vector with all components set to 1.

@sl-slua/global/vector.create.documentation: Creates a new vector with the given component values.

@sl-slua/global/vector.magnitude.documentation: Computes the magnitude of the vector.

@sl-slua/global/vector.normalize.documentation: Computes the normalized version (unit vector) of the vector.

@sl-slua/global/vector.cross.documentation: Computes the cross product of two vectors.

@sl-slua/global/vector.dot.documentation: Computes the dot product of two vectors.

@sl-slua/global/vector.angle.documentation: Computes the angle between two vectors in radians. The axis, if specified, is used to determine the sign of the angle.

@sl-slua/global/vector.floor.documentation: Applies math.floor to each component of the vector.

@sl-slua/global/vector.ceil.documentation: Applies math.ceil to each component of the vector.

@sl-slua/global/vector.abs.documentation: Applies math.abs to each component of the vector.

@sl-slua/global/vector.sign.documentation: Applies math.sign to each component of the vector.

@sl-slua/global/vector.clamp.documentation: Clamps each component of the vector between min and max values.

@sl-slua/global/vector.max.documentation: Applies math.max to each component of the vectors.

@sl-slua/global/vector.min.documentation: Applies math.max to each component of the vectors.

@sl-slua/global/vector.lerp.documentation: Linearly interpolates between a and b using factor t.
